This example tutorial illustrates:
Tutorial WIKI
http://wiki.eclipse.org/EclipseLink/Examples/JPA/WebLogic_Web_Tutorial
Demo URL:
http://127.0.0.1:7001/enterprise/FrontController?action=demo

- Deployment of a simple servlet client based JPA EAR application on Oracle WebLogic 10.3 Server
- No use of a Web application framework like JSF, Struts or client side Ajax - so minimize setup conflicts - Pure JPA - no native ORM at this point unless required as a workaround for the container - Container managed entity manager where possible - except for DDL generation - Smallest entity model possible - a single entity with a @ManyToMany to itself - Entity model has no container specific annotations - Use of a transactional container managed JPA EclipseLink entityManager on a stateless session bean
- How to integrate with the Oracle WebLogic Server plugin for the Eclipse IDE


Requirements:
- WebLogic Server 10.3
- A database (Oracle 10 is used by this example)
- an HTML browser

Modifications:
- modify persistence.xml for your particular database if not using Oracle
